Package main.java.login

Class LoginManager

java.lang.Object
main.java.login.LoginManager
public class LoginManager extends Object
The LoginManager class is responsible for managing user accounts and main.java.login authentication.
Since:
2023-05-11
Version:
1.0
Author:
Zac Healy

  • Constructor Summary

    LoginManager()
    Constructor that initialises the default user accounts.

  • Constructor Details

    • LoginManager

      public LoginManager()
      Constructor that initialises the default user accounts.

      Side-effect Adds a user to the global HashMap that stores user accounts.

  • Method Details

    • addUserAccount

      public void addUserAccount(String username, String password)
      Adds a user account to the global HashMap that stores user accounts.

      Side-effect Adds a user to the global HashMap that stores user accounts.

      Parameters:
      username - The username of the user account to be added.
      password - The password of the user account to be added.

    • isUsernameValid

      public boolean isUsernameValid(String username)
      Checks if a username is valid.

      Side-effect free. Referentially transparent.

      Parameters:
      username - The username to check for validity.
      Returns:
      true if the username is valid, false otherwise.

    • isUsernamePasswordValid

      public boolean isUsernamePasswordValid(String username, String password)
      Checks if a username and password combination is valid.

      Side-effect free. Referentially transparent.

      Parameters:
      username - The username to check for validity.
      password - The password to check for validity.
      Returns:
      true if the username and password combination is valid, false otherwise.

    • getLoginTypeForAccess

      public main.java.login.LoginType getLoginTypeForAccess(String username)
      Determines the type of main.java.login access based on the username.

      Side-effect free. Referentially transparent.

      Parameters:
      username - The username to determine the type of main.java.login access for.
      Returns:
      LoginType.SUCCESS if the first character of the username is uppercase, LoginType.GUEST_ACCESS otherwise.

    • getLoginTypeString

      public String getLoginTypeString(main.java.login.LoginType loginType)
      Returns a string representation of the main.java.login type based on the given main.java.login type.

      Side-effect free. Referentially transparent.

      Parameters:
      loginType - The main.java.login type to be converted to a string.
      Returns:
      A string representation of the main.java.login type.

    • printLoginMessage

      public void printLoginMessage(main.java.login.LoginType loginType)
      Prints a main.java.login message to the console based on the given main.java.login type.

      Side-effect free.

      Parameters:
      loginType - The main.java.login type to be used in the main.java.login message.

    • main.java.login

      public main.java.login.LoginType main.java.login(String username, String password)
      Attempts to main.java.login with the given username and password and returns the main.java.login type representing the access status.

      Side-effect free. Referentially transparent.

      Parameters:
      username - The username to be used for main.java.login.
      password - The password to be used for main.java.login.
      Returns:
      The LoginType enum representing the access status.
